# drawPage(at:in:)

**Instance Method**

Draws a page of content for the printer.

## Declaration

```swift
func drawPage(at pageIndex: Int, in printableRect: CGRect)
```

## Parameters

- **pageIndex**: The index of the page to draw.
- **printableRect**: The rectangle in which to draw printable content.

## Discussion

The default implementation of this method calls, in sequence, [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintPageRenderer/drawHeaderForPage(at:in:)], [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintPageRenderer/drawContentForPage(at:in:)], [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintPageRenderer/drawPrintFormatter(_:forPageAt:)], and [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintPageRenderer/drawFooterForPage(at:in:)]. Override this method to draw the specified page of content for the printer.

The system configures this method for drawing to the current graphics context according to [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIGraphicsGetCurrentContext()].

## Drawing a page

- **drawHeaderForPage(at:in:)**: Draws the header of a page.
- **drawContentForPage(at:in:)**: Draws the content of a page.
- **drawPrintFormatter(_:forPageAt:)**: Performs custom drawing in addition to the specified print formatter’s drawing for a page.
- **drawFooterForPage(at:in:)**: Draws the footer of a page.
